''Probably'' descended from [[Voronwë (companion of Elendil)|Voronwë]], a companion of [[Elendil]]{{SD|70}}, p. 278 | siblings= | spouse= | children=[[Tréowine]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Céolwulf''' was the father of [[Tréowine]], a close friend of the famous mariner [[Ælfwine]].{{SD|69}}, p. 269 == Etymology == The name ''Céolwulf'' is in [[Old English]]. It might be derived from the elements ''ceol'' ("keel") + ''wulf'' ("wolf").{{webcite|website=Behind the Name|articlename=Ceolwulf|articleurl=http://www.behindthename.com/name/ceolwulf/submitted}} == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | VOR | |VOR=[[Voronwë (companion of Elendil)|Voronwë]]

[[wikipedia:914|914 AD]]''}} {{familytree/end}} == Other versions of the legendarium == In one of the manuscripts of ''[[The Notion Club Papers]]'', during the recital of the ''[[Lay of King Sheave]]'' in [[Edward the Elder]]'s court, it wasn't Ælfwine or Tréowine who recited the poem, but rather one Céolwulf (who wasn't the father of Tréowine at that point).{{SD|2dn}}, Note 103, p. 273 {{references}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ceolwulf}} [[Category:Anglo-Saxons]] [[Category:Characters from the later Ages]] [[Category:The Notion Club Papers]] [[Category:Old English names]]
